abstracts.cdata!:
The Request for Inspection for the
            Special Structural Adjustment Loan in Argentina examines
            statements by the Requesters that claim that budget cuts to
            the Pro Huerta program have harmed and will harm the
            intended beneficiaries who are the absolute poor. The Pro
            Huerta program provides food and nutrition assistance to the
            absolute poor. The Requesters feel that, in conformity with
            the Bank's policy on poverty reduction, Pro Huerta was
            specifically included in the Loan Agreement as one of the
            programs the Bank considers must be protected under the
            social and economic program supported by the SSAL. If the
            Bank allowed the program to terminate, they would be
            violating their own rules and regulations. The Requesters
            list several violations by the Bank against social programs
            that were originally funded through the Special Structural
            Adjustment Loan.
